drinkName.name: Ramos Gin Fizz
drinkName.about: The fizzy Ramos Gin Fizz cocktail is all shook up.

mix.how: Add all the ingredients except the club soda into a shaker and dry-shake vigorously (without ice).
Fill with ice and shake again.
Strain into a Collins glass.
Pour a little bit of club soda back and forth between the empty halves of the shaker to pick up any residual egg white, then pour into the glass.

drinkName.name: Uncle Angelo’s Eggnog
drinkName.about: You’ll be claiming Angelo as your own relative after just one sip of this delightful Eggnog recipe.

ingredients.ingredient: Spiced rum (Captain Morgan or Sailor Jerry)

mix.how: In a large bowl, beat together the egg yolks and half a cup of sugar until they turn light in color.
Stir in the milk, heavy cream, bourbon and rum.
In a separate bowl, beat the egg whites with the remaining quarter-cup of sugar until they form soft peaks.
Fold about a third of the egg whites into the yolk mixture.
Serve in punch or tea cups topped with freshly grated nutmeg, folding in more of the egg whites as desired.

drinkName.name: Pimm’s Pony
drinkName.about: The liqueur pairs beautifully with Hendrick’s Gin.

mix.how: Add the gin and Pimm's to a shaker and fill with ice.
Shake, and strain into a half-pint glass.
Top with the Sprite and crown with cucumber foam.

drinkName.name: Cucumber, Basil & Lime Gimlet
drinkName.about: The classic combination of gin, lime juice and simple syrup gets a fresh-produce boost in the Cucumber, Basil & Lime Gimlet. Swap out gin for vodka, add a little lemonade and you’ve got the ideal warm-weather cocktail.

mix.how: Muddle the basil and cucumber in a shaker.
Add the remaining ingredients and ice and shake.
Strain into a rocks glass over fresh ice.
Garnish with a lime wedge or cucumber wheel.

drinkName.name: My Spicy Valentine
drinkName.about: You’ll fall in love with this creamy, chocolaty and chile pepper-spiked vodka cocktail.

mix.how: In a shaker, muddle the chile slices.
Add the remaining ingredients and fill with ice.
Shake, and strain into a coupe glass.

drinkName.name: Jamaican Breeze
drinkName.about: It just blew in from Montego Bay.

mix.how: In a shaker, muddle the ginger.
Add the remaining ingredients and fill with ice.
Shake, and strain into a rocks glass filled with fresh ice.
Garnish with a lime wheel.

drinkName.name: Super Sunday Punch Bowl of Freedom
drinkName.about: Whether you’re watching football, baseball or basketball, this bourbon punch goes well with friends and sports.

mix.how: Wrap the cinnamon sticks, cloves and allspice in cheesecloth, tie into a bundle and place in a punch bowl.
Add the remaining ingredients and stir thoroughly.
Fill with ice, stir and garnish with apple slices.
(If assembling ahead of time, refrigerate after stirring together the ingredients and add the ice just before serving.).

drinkName.name: Cherry Bulldog
drinkName.about: Move over tonic. Gin and cherries may be the perfect combination.

mix.how: In a shaker, muddle the cherries, anise, lime and sugar.
Add the gin and port, and fill with ice.
Shake well and double strain into a Martini glass.
Garnish with cherries.

drinkName.name: Boulevardier
drinkName.about: Swap out the gin in a Negroni for rye whiskey and you get the delicious Boulevardier. It’s equally complex as its gin-based predecessor, but the whiskey adds warmth, making it perfect for autumn and winter drinking.

mix.how: Add all the ingredients to a rocks glass filled with ice and stir to combine.
Garnish with an orange twist.
To serve the drink up, add all the ingredients to a mixing glass and fill with ice.
Stir, and strain into a cocktail glass.
Garnish with an orange twist.

drinkName.name: B-52
drinkName.about: Believed to have originated in the 1970 by a bartender and fan of the iconic band, the B-52 is classic guilty pleasure armed with three liqueurs. Make this layered shooter in seconds and impress all your friends.

ingredients.ingredient:
Coffee liqueur
Try it with Kahlúa

mix.how: Layer the three spirits in a shot glass in the order they're listed.

drinkName.name: East Side Elder
drinkName.about: You don’t have to be from the east or old to enjoy this St-Germain, Plymouth Gin, cucumber and mint cocktail.

mix.how: In a shaker, muddle the mint and cucumber.
Add the remaining ingredients and fill with ice.
Shake, and strain into a highball glass filled with fresh ice or a chilled Martini glass.
Garnish with a mint leaf and a cucumber slice.

drinkName.name: The Translucent Cocktail
drinkName.about: There’s nothing odorless or tasteless about this cocktail.

mix.how: Add all the ingredients to a mixing glass and fill with ice.
Stir, and strain into a Martini glass.
Garnish with a Bols Genever-soaked cherry speared on a toothpick.

drinkName.name: No. 3 Gin & Tonic
drinkName.about: You’ll enjoy the classic Gin & Tonic on a hot day, a cold day or really any day at all.

mix.how: Fill a double rocks glass with ice.
Add the gin and fill with tonic.
Garnish with a lime wedge.

drinkName.name: Angel’s Face
drinkName.about: Made from gin, applejack and apricot liqueur, this cocktail is fruity but powerful.

mix.how: Add all the ingredients to a mixing glass and fill with ice.
Stir, and strain into a cocktail glass.
Garnish with a slice of orange peel.

drinkName.name: Adam and VEEV
drinkName.about: Go ahead: give into temptation.

mix.how: Add all the ingredients to a shaker and fill with ice.
Shake, and strain into a highball glass filled with fresh ice or a chilled cocktail glass.
Garnish with an apple slice or mint sprig.

drinkName.name: Dub Treo
drinkName.about: Jamaica meets Italy in this powerful combination of rum, vermouth and Aperol.

mix.how: Add all the ingredients to a mixing glass and fill with ice.
Stir till very cold and strain into a chilled cocktail glass.
Garnish with an orange peel.

drinkName.name: Samba Breeze
drinkName.about: This simple cocktail is as refreshing as it sounds.

mix.how: Add all the ingredients to a shaker and fill with ice.
Shake, and strain into a highball glass filled with fresh ice.
Garnish with an orange slice.

drinkName.name: Baileys Velvet Mocha
drinkName.about: Curl up in front of the fireplace with this mixture of hot chocolate and java.

mix.how: Pour the Baileys and hot chocolate into a coffee mug.
Top with a dollop of whipped cream.
Garnish with 3 coffee beans.

drinkName.name: Finlandia Vodka Helsinki Mule
drinkName.about: You don’t have to be stubborn to give this cocktail a try.

mix.how: Add all the ingredients to a shaker and fill with ice.
Shake, and strain into a tall glass filled with fresh ice.
Garnish with a lime wedge.

drinkName.name: Dubious Manhattan
drinkName.about: Don’t worry about the name; there’s no reason to doubt this classic cocktail.

mix.how: Add all the ingredients to a shaker and fill with ice.
Shake vigorously and strain into a Martini glass.
Spear 3 Drunken Plumped Cherries on a cocktail pick and drop into the drink.

drinkName.name: Peanut Butter Cup Martini
drinkName.about: A cocktail with peanut rum, chocolate liqueur and vodka. Take that, Reese’s!

mix.how: Drizzle chocolate syrup along the inside of a chilled Martini glass and place the glass in the refrigerator.
Add the remaining ingredients to a shaker and fill with ice.
Shake vigorously and strain into the prepared glass.
Garnish with a peanut butter cup.

drinkName.name: Maple Old Fashioned
drinkName.about: Forget pancakes! Use your maple syrup in cocktails.

mix.how: Add all the ingredients to a shaker and fill with ice.
Shake, and strain into a chilled cocktail glass.

drinkName.name: French Connection
drinkName.about: The simple two-ingredient French Connection is one of the best ways to enjoy a young cognac.

ingredients.ingredient:
Cognac
Try it with Martell VS

mix.how: Add the ingredients into an Old Fashioned glass over ice and stir briefly.

drinkName.name: Tart n’ Sand
drinkName.about: Warm up with this tasty Scotch cocktail.

mix.how: In a shaker, muddle the cherries.
Add the remaining ingredients and fill with ice.
Shake well and strain into a cocktail glass.
Garnish with an orange slice.

drinkName.name: Pom Blanco
drinkName.about: Sweet, tart and ice cold. Plus a big slug of tequila.

mix.how: Add all the ingredients to a cocktail shaker and fill with ice.
Shake well and strain into a highball glass filled with fresh ice.
Garnish with a lime wedge.

drinkName.name: Alfie’s Apple
drinkName.about: With a mezcal base plus apple cider and a fizzy apple soda, this cocktail makes an intriguing fall sipper.

mix.how: If desired, combine equal parts five-spice powder and sugar, and use to coat the rim of a tall glass.
Fill the glass with ice and set aside.
Add the remaining ingredients except the Sidral Mundet to a cocktail shaker and fill with ice.
Shake vigorously and strain into the prepared glass.
Top with the Sidral Mundet and stir gently.
Garnish with an apple slice.

drinkName.name: Coffee Cocktail
drinkName.about: The classic Coffee Cocktail is actually caffeine-free.

mix.how: Add all the ingredients to a cocktail shaker and fill with ice.
Shake, and strain into a port glass.
Dust with freshly grated nutmeg.

drinkName.name: Champagne Dreams
drinkName.about: Bubbly meets pomegranate in this gorgeous crimson cocktail.

mix.how: Add all the ingredients except the Champagne to a shaker and fill with ice.
Shake vigorously and strain into a chilled Champagne flute.
Top with the Champagne and garnish with an orange twist.

drinkName.name: Basil Hayden’s Last Stand
drinkName.about: Subtle hints of lemon and absinthe accentuate this bourbon cocktail.

mix.how: Add the absinthe to a pint glass and swirl to thoroughly coat the glass.
Discard any excess absinthe and add the bourbon and bitters.
Squeeze the lemon wedge into the glass and drop it in.
Fill three-quarters of the way with ice and stir swiftly for 20 seconds.
Top with soda.

drinkName.name: Timmy’s Brandy Milk Punch
drinkName.about: Enjoy the classic New Orleans cocktail, Brandy Milk Punch, with brunch.

ingredients.ingredient: Powdered sugar, plus more to taste

mix.how: Add all the ingredients to a blender and fill with ice.
Blend for 20 seconds.
Taste, and add more sugar if desired.
Strain the mixture into four tall glasses filled with crushed ice.

drinkName.name: Banker’s Lunch
drinkName.about: Ketel One Vodka with grapefruit juice and orange liqueur. Hold the adding machine.

mix.how: Add all the ingredients to a mixing glass and fill with ice.
Stir, and strain into a rocks glass.
Garnish with a grapefruit peel.

drinkName.name: Stone Sour
drinkName.about: The icy bourbon Stone Sour is perfect for a hot summer night.

mix.how: Add all the ingredients to a shaker and fill with ice.
Shake, and strain into a rocks glass filled with fresh ice.
Garnish with an orange half-wheel and a cherry.

drinkName.name: My Funny Clementine
drinkName.about: You’ll be smiling after a taste of this gin and citrus cocktail.

mix.how: Add all the ingredients except the prosecco or Champagne to a shaker and fill with ice.
Shake, and strain into a Champagne flute.
Top with prosecco or Champagne and garnish with a clementine or orange wedge or twist.

drinkName.name: Naughty or Nice
drinkName.about: Mix up a big bowl of this morally ambiguous punch.

mix.how: Add all the ingredients and a large block of ice to a punch bowl.
Garnish with blood orange slices.

drinkName.name: White Bat
drinkName.about: There is no shame in drinking this guilty pleasure.

mix.how: Add all the ingredients to a highball glass filled with ice.
Garnish with mint leaves if desired.

drinkName.name: The London Soul
drinkName.about: This bubbly whiskey drink isn’t English, but it does have soul.

mix.how: Add the whiskey, lemon juice and syrup to a shaker and fill with ice.
Shake, and strain into a Collins glass filled with fresh ice.
Top with the club soda and garnish with a mint sprig.

drinkName.name: Gentleman Bowery
drinkName.about: This tart whiskey cocktail combines orange, lemon and pomegranate flavors.

ingredients.ingredient: Pomegranate grenadine (one part Pom Wonderful Pomegranate Juice, one part sugar)

mix.how: Add all the ingredients to a shaker and fill with ice.
Shake, and strain into a Collins glass filled with fresh ice.
Garnish with a lemon half-wheel.

drinkName.name: St-Rita
drinkName.about: One part tequila and one part St-Germain. Simple but elegant.

mix.how: If desired, coat the rim of a rocks or Collins glass with salt and fill with ice.
Add the remaining ingredients to a shaker and fill with ice.
Shake, and fine strain into the prepared glass.
Garnish with a lime wedge.

drinkName.name: Alabama Slammer
drinkName.about: The Alabama Slammer might just be the most ’70s of the bright and fruity 1970s cocktails. Its base blend of amaretto, sloe gin and SoCo stands in total defiance of what one would expect from a staunch Southern sipper. Yet the drink looms large below the Mason-Dixon line and beyond.

ingredients.ingredient:
Sloe gin
Try it with Plymouth sloe gin

mix.how: Add all the ingredients into a shaker with ice and shake.
Strain into a highball glass over fresh ice.
Garnish with an orange wheel and a cherry, and serve with a straw.

drinkName.name: Jack & Canton
drinkName.about: Despite his tough reputation, Jack actually plays quite well with others.

mix.how: Add the Jack Daniel's, Domaine de Canton and lime juice to a shaker and fill with ice.
Shake, and pour (unstrained) into a tall glass.
Top with a splash of tonic water, stir briefly and garnish with a lime wedge.

drinkName.name: Smoky Martini
drinkName.about: Replace the vermouth in a classic Martini with scotch and you get something altogether different.

mix.how: Add both ingredients to a mixing glass and fill with ice.
Stir, and strain into a Martini glass.
Garnish with a lemon twist.

drinkName.name: Cerise Light
drinkName.about: A little gin adds the perfect depth to this pomegranate and Champagne cocktail.

mix.how: Add the gin and the pomegranate juice to a shaker and fill with ice.
Shake, and strain into a chilled Champagne flute or small coupe.
Top with the Champagne.

drinkName.name: Americano
drinkName.about: Mix up the Americano on the Fourth of July or anytime the spirit moves you.

mix.how: Pour the Campari and vermouth into a rocks or highball glass filled with ice.
Add a splash of club soda and garnish with an orange twist.

drinkName.name: El Presidente
drinkName.about: Hail to the chief and mix up El Presidente cocktail.

mix.how: Add all the ingredients to a shaker and fill with ice.
Shake, and strain into a chilled cocktail glass.

drinkName.name: Paloma
drinkName.about: Celebrate Cinco de Mayo year-round with the tasty Paloma cocktail.

ingredients.ingredient:
Tequila
Try it with Avión Silver

mix.how: Add the tequila and lime juice to a highball glass filled with ice.
Fill with grapefruit soda, and stir briefly.

drinkName.name: No. 3 Gimlet
drinkName.about: Mix up this deliciously citrusy gin Gimlet.

mix.how: Add all the ingredients to a shaker and fill with ice.
Shake, and strain into a cocktail glass.
Garnish with a lime wheel.

drinkName.name: Last-Minute Mulled Wine
drinkName.about: For unexpected guests, throw together the classic Last-Minute Mulled Wine with ingredients you probably have in the pantry. When unexpected guests arrive at the door, there’s no easier party punch than Last-Minute Mulled Wine. Got a bottle of red wine lying around? Spike it with warm pantry spices like cinnamon and star anise, then amp up the flavor even further with a splash of bourbon or brandy. That’s how you capture the holidays in a mug.

ingredients.ingredient: Fruity red wine (such as Beaujolais or syrah)
Long strip of lemon or orange peel

mix.how: Add all of the ingredients to a small saucepan.
Cook over low heat until warm (do not boil), remove from the heat and let stand for 5 to 10 minutes.
Serve in mugs or punch cups, garnished with cinnamon sticks.

drinkName.name: VeeV Holiday Cider
drinkName.about: Give a warm glass of cider a festive upgrade.

mix.how: Add the VeeV to a lowball glass and top with cider.
Garnish with a cinnamon stick and a slice of orange peel.

drinkName.name: Forbidden Fruit
drinkName.about: With apple, lemon and ginger flavors, it’s like autumn in a glass.

ingredients.ingredient: Laird's Straight Bottled in Bond Apple Brandy

mix.how: Add all the ingredients except the ginger beer to a shaker and fill with ice.
Shake, and strain into a highball glass filled with fresh ice.
Top with ginger beer and garnish with a lemon half-wheel.

drinkName.name: Glögg
drinkName.about: Let this Scandinavian Glögg warm you to the core.

mix.how: Add all the ingredients to a large saucepan over medium heat.
Heat to a simmer, remove from the heat and let stand for 2 hours.
Strain, and reheat.
Serve in mugs, garnished with raisins and sliced blanched almonds.

drinkName.name: Baileys Toasted Almond Brittle
drinkName.about: Enjoy a little crunch with the smooth taste of Baileys.

ingredients.ingredient: Baileys with a Hint of Caramel

mix.how: Mix equal parts honey and warm water in a small bowl and stir until dissolved.
Place crushed almonds onto a small plate.
Dip the rim of a Martini glass into the honey water and then into the crushed almonds and set aside.
Add the remaining ingredients to a shaker and fill with ice.
Shake well and strain into the prepared glass.

drinkName.name: Hot Shot
drinkName.about: It takes a steady hand to make this layered shot.

mix.how: Carefully layer the ingredients in a shot glass in the order shown (Galliano on the bottom, cream on the top).

drinkName.name: Grape Escape
drinkName.about: Get away from it all with this fruity cocktail.

mix.how: In a shaker, muddle the kiwi, grapes and mint.
Add the remaining ingredients, fill with ice and shake.
Strain into a Martini glass and garnish with a mint leaf and a sliced grape.

drinkName.name: Coquito
drinkName.about: This rich and creamy rum-spiked Coquito is a classic Puerto Rican holiday cocktail recipe.

ingredients.ingredient: Cream of coconut (such as Coco Lopez)

mix.how: Combine all the ingredients except the rum in a saucepan over medium heat.
Bring to a simmer, stirring constantly.
Remove from the heat, let cool, and stir in the rum.
Transfer to bottles (making sure that at least one cinnamon stick goes into each bottle), seal and store in the refrigerator.
Serve over ice in rocks glasses.
Garnish with 2 cinnamon sticks.

drinkName.name: Stoli Blueberi Fog
drinkName.about: You’ll want this simple tipple to roll in even on sunny days.

ingredients.ingredient: Simple syrup (one part sugar, one part water) or agave nectar

mix.how: Add all the ingredients to a shaker and fill with ice.
Shake, and strain into a chilled Martini glass.

drinkName.name: Black Ship
drinkName.about: Set sail on this whisky and pomegranate vessel.

mix.how: Add all the ingredients to a shaker and fill with ice.
Shake, and strain into a chilled Martini glass.
Garnish with a lemon peel.

drinkName.name: (ri)1 Spiced Rye Punch
drinkName.about: Spike your iced tea with rye whiskey.

ingredients.ingredient: Demerara syrup (one part Demerara sugar, one part water)

mix.how: Add all the ingredients to a mixing glass, fill with ice and stir.
Strain into an Old Fashioned glass filled with fresh ice.
Garnish with 2 lemon wheels and freshly grated nutmeg.

drinkName.name: The Hornitos Hot Shotty
drinkName.about: Añejo tequila and spicy chili powder give a kick to this spiked hot chocolate.

mix.how: Add the tequila and hot chocolate to a half-pint glass.
Garnish with a dollop of whipped cream and a dash of chili powder.

drinkName.name: Hera’s Crown
drinkName.about: This cocktail has so much flavor you won’t miss the alcohol.

mix.how: Add all the ingredients except the club soda to a shaker.
Fill with ice and shake.
Add the club soda and gently roll the shaker back and forth to mix.
Strain into a chilled cocktail glass and garnish with an orange twist.

drinkName.name: Patrón Pineapple
drinkName.about: Tired of Margaritas? Try this simple tequila and pineapples juice cocktail.

mix.how: Pour Patrón Silver Tequila and Patrón Citrónge into a rocks glass full of ice.
Fill with pineapple juice and finish with a squeeze of lime.
Garnish the drink with a lime wheel.

drinkName.name: Jack-o-Lantern Punch
drinkName.about: Mix up a whole bunch of this fall-flavored punch for your Halloween party.

ingredients.ingredient: Flor de Caña 7-Year-Old Grand Reserve Rum

mix.how: In a mixing glass, muddle the sugar cubes, cloves and 1 ounce of the soda until the sugar dissolves.
Add the remaining ingredients and fill with ice.
Stir, and strain into a punch cup.
Top with the remaining 2 ounces of club soda and garnish with apple slices, cinnamon sticks and pumpkin seeds.
(You can also multiply this recipe, stir and strain into a punch bowl. Top each individual portion with club soda when serving).

drinkName.name: Bloody-tini
drinkName.about: A cocktail you can really sink your teeth into.

mix.how: Add all the ingredients except the Champagne to a shaker and fill with ice.
Shake, and strain into a chilled Martini glass.
Top with Champagne and garnish with a fresh lime wedge.

drinkName.name: Safe Kicker
drinkName.about: Created by a team of four top San Francisco bartenders, this drink won a Gentleman Jack cocktail competition.

ingredients.ingredient: Fee Brothers Whiskey Barrel Aged Bitters

mix.how: Add all the ingredients to a shaker and shake without ice.
Fill with ice, shake again and double-strain into an Old Fashioned glass.
Twist a slice of cara cara orange peel over the drink, spear it on a toothpick with three cherries and use it as garnish.

drinkName.name: Cocoa Loco
drinkName.about: All the chocolate and rum craziness you can handle.

mix.how: Add all the ingredients except the whipped cream to a small saucepan and simmer over low to medium heat until hot.
Strain into a mug and top with whipped cream.
Garnish with grated pistachio.

drinkName.name: Horni Toddy
drinkName.about: Rich añejo tequila stands in for whiskey in this hot classic.

mix.how: Coat the bottom of a mug with honey and add the tequila and lemon juice.
Stir in the hot tea.
Garnish with a cinnamon stick and lemon wheel.

drinkName.name: Irish Blonde
drinkName.about: St Patrick’s Day is around the corner. Start preparing now.

mix.how: Add all the ingredients to a mixing glass and fill with ice.
Stir, and strain into a chilled Martini glass.
Garnish with a flamed orange peel.

drinkName.name: Pumpkin & Spice
drinkName.about: A clever oatmeal-infused vodka is why this fall drink is truly unique.

mix.how: Add all the ingredients except the ginger beer to a shaker and fill with ice.
Shake vigorously for 25 seconds and strain into a rocks glass filled with fresh ice.
Top with the ginger beer and garnish with freshly grated nutmeg.

drinkName.name: Negroni Sbagliato
drinkName.about: Though its name means incorrect Negroni, this bubbly punch is the right drink for your next party.

mix.how: Add the vermouth and liqueur to a punch bowl and add large ice cubes or a large ice block.
Add the fruit and top with the prosecco.
Stir gently and garnish with freshly grated cinnamon.

drinkName.name: Finlandia Vodka Midnight Sun Martini
drinkName.about: This cocktail will ensure that the sun never sets on your evening.

mix.how: Add all the ingredients to a shaker and fill with ice.
Shake, and strain into a Martini glass.
Garnish with a cherry.

drinkName.name: Pear & Cranberry Fizz
drinkName.about: This concoction will give your fall a fruity and spirited boost.

mix.how: In a shaker, muddle the lemon juice and cranberries.
Add the remaining ingredients except the club soda and fill with ice.
Shake vigorously for 20 seconds and pour (unstrained) into a highball glass.
Add additional ice to fill the glass if needed and top with club soda.
Garnish with pear slices and fresh cranberries.

drinkName.name: Eden’s Apple
drinkName.about: Homemade apple-cinnamon vodka makes this sweet concoction a perfect autumn elixir.

ingredients.ingredient: Apple- and Cinnamon-Infused Karlsson's Gold Vodka

mix.how: Add all the ingredients to a shaker and fill with ice.
Shake vigorously for 30 seconds and double-strain into a frozen coupe glass.
Garnish with an apple slice.
(This drink may also be served warm: Combine all the ingredients in a small saucepan over medium heat and stir until warm, then strain into the coupe glass and garnish.).

drinkName.name: Beachbum’s Own
drinkName.about: The Tiki mug is optional but come on, you know you want one.

ingredients.ingredient: Demerara rum (El Dorado or Lemon Hart)

mix.how: Add all the ingredients to a shaker and fill with crushed ice.
Shake, and pour (unstrained) into a Tiki mug or a double Old Fashioned glass.

drinkName.name: South Side
drinkName.about: Despite its name, there are no geographical limitations for this gin cocktail.

mix.how: In a shaker, gently muddle the mint and lemon juice.
Add the remaining ingredients and fill with ice.
Shake, and strain into a chilled Martini glass.
Garnish with a mint sprig or lemon twist.

drinkName.name: Autumn Wassail
drinkName.about: A glass of this spiced-apple-cider-and-cognac concoction is just the thing for a chilly or warm afternoon.

ingredients.ingredient: Wassail, hot (or 3 oz wassail, chilled, if serving cold)

mix.how: To serve hot, add the cognac and rum to a Toddy glass and top with the wassail.
Garnish with apple slices or fresh cranberries.
To serve cold, add all the ingredients to a shaker and fill with ice.
Shake, and strain into a chilled cocktail glass.

drinkName.name: Zacapa Hot Toddy
drinkName.about: If you’re feeling under-the-weather, this toasty beverage will perk you right up.

mix.how: Pour the water into a footed Irish coffee mug.
Add the remaining ingredients to a cocktail shaker.
Shake well, pour into the mug and stir.
Garnish with a lemon wedge.

drinkName.name: Midnight Prayer
drinkName.about: Giving thanks has never been easier.

mix.how: Add all the ingredients to a mixing glass and fill with ice.
Stir for thirty seconds and strain into a chilled small cocktail glass.
Garnish with a broad slice of lemon peel.

drinkName.name: (ri)1 Clove & Oak
drinkName.about: A perfect autumn cocktail, with rye whiskey and apple cider.

mix.how: Add all the ingredients to a shaker and fill with ice.
Shake vigorously for at least 6 seconds.
Strain into a chilled cocktail glass and garnish with apple slices.

drinkName.name: Mint Muse
drinkName.about: Get inspired by absinthe, mint and pineapple juice.

mix.how: Muddle the mint leaves with the lime wedge in a shaker.
Add the Lucid Absinthe, pineapple juice and fill with ice.
Shake briefly and strain into a tall glass filled with fresh ice.
Top with Sprite or 7-Up and garnish with a mint sprig and lime wedge.

drinkName.name: The Flanders
drinkName.about: Hi-diddly-ho whisky-rino!

mix.how: Add all the ingredients to a shaker and fill with ice.
Shake, and strain into a Martini glass.
Garnish with a cherry.

drinkName.name: Mexican Punch
drinkName.about: The perfect punch to put any fiesta into gear.

ingredients.ingredient: Simple syrup (one part sugar, one part water)

mix.how: In a large pitcher, muddle the limes, lemons and orange.
Add the tequila, simple syrup, lime juice, grenadine and bitters.
Stir well and add ice.
Top with the 7Up and stir gently.
Pour (unstrained) into 6 wine glasses and garnish each with a lime wedge.

drinkName.name: Stoli Gala Applik Sangria
drinkName.about: Sweet-and-tart apple vodka is a great addition to the classic.

mix.how: Add all the ingredients to a pitcher and fill with ice (For extra flavor, muddle the fruit before adding the remaining ingredients).
Stir, and pour into a tall glass filled with fresh ice.

drinkName.name: Hendrick’s Breakfast Martini
drinkName.about: The most important meal of the day just got a whole lot more fun.

mix.how: Add all of the ingredients to a cocktail shaker and fill with ice.
Shake, and strain into a cocktail glass.
Garnish with a lemon peel and serve with buttered toast on the side.

drinkName.name: Espresso Martini
drinkName.about: What do you get when you mix tequila and espresso? One hell of a cocktail.

mix.how: Coat the rim of a cocktail glass with sugar.
Add the remaining ingredients to a shaker and fill with ice.
Shake, and strain into the prepared glass.
Garnish with powdered chocolate.

drinkName.name: Apples & Pears
drinkName.about: This autumnal vodka cocktail contains both.

mix.how: Add all the ingredients except the cider to a shaker and fill with ice.
Shake well and strain into a double Old Fashioned glass filled with fresh ice.
Top with the cider and garnish with an apple slice and a sprinkle of grated nutmeg.

drinkName.name: Mojito Italiano
drinkName.about: Celebrate the red, white and green with a little Campari, lemon and rum.

mix.how: In a shaker, muddle the mint, syrup and lemon juice. Add the Campari and rum, and fill with ice.
Shake, and strain into a highball glass filled with fresh ice.
Top with prosecco and garnish with a mint sprig.

drinkName.name: Maker’s Mark Mojito
drinkName.about: Try this Kentucky take on the Cuban classic.

mix.how: Coat the rim of a tall glass with sugar and set aside.
In a mixing glass, muddle the simple syrup and mint.
Squeeze in the juice from the lime wedges and add the bourbon and triple sec.
Fill with ice and stir.
Pour (unstrained) into the prepared glass and top with the soda.
Garnish with an additional lime wedge.

drinkName.name: Fashionable Manhattan
drinkName.about: This delicious bourbon cocktail is what happens when a Manhattan and an Old Fashioned hang out together.

mix.how: In a cocktail glass, lightly muddle the bitters, lime, lemon and orange.
Remove the fruit remnants and discard.
Add the bourbon and vermouth to a shaker and fill with ice.
Shake vigorously and strain into the prepared glass.
Run a bar spoon around the inside of the glass to incorporate the bitters and fruit oils.
Garnish with a lightly crushed maraschino cherry.

drinkName.name: Summer’s End
drinkName.about: Combine summer and autumn flavors in this simple drink you can make any time of year.

mix.how: Add all the ingredients to a mixing glass and fill with ice.
Stir, and strain into a Martini glass.
Garnish with a lemon twist and a cherry.

drinkName.name: Northern Spy
drinkName.about: Go undercover with this top-secret applejack cocktail.

mix.how: Add all the ingredients to a shaker and fill with ice.
Shake, and strain into a small cocktail glass or coupe.
Top with cava or sparkling white wine.

drinkName.name: Smuggler’s Cove Straits Sling
drinkName.about: You don’t need a pegleg, a parrot or a tri-cornered hat to enjoy this drink.

ingredients.ingredient: Demerara syrup (one part Demerara sugar, one part water)

mix.how: Add all the ingredients except the club soda to a mixing glass and fill with ice.
Stir, and strain into a Collins glass filled with fresh ice.
Top with the club soda and garnish with a lemon slice.

drinkName.name: Hudson Highland Cup
drinkName.about: With apple butter, maple syrup and hard cider, this cocktail is like fall in a cup.

ingredients.ingredient: Highland Park 12-Year-Old Single Malt Scotch Whisky

mix.how: Add all the ingredients except the hard cider to a shaker and fill with ice.
Shake, and strain into a highball glass filled with fresh ice.
Top with hard cider and garnish with an apple slice.

drinkName.name: Roosevelt
drinkName.about: Channel the original Rough Rider with this rum cocktail.

mix.how: Add all the ingredients to a shaker and fill with ice.
Shake, and strain into a chilled cocktail glass.
Garnish with an orange twist.

drinkName.name: Don Julio Hot Nantucket Night
drinkName.about: Heat things up with this spicy tequila tipple.

mix.how: In a highball glass, muddle the cranberries and jalapeño slice.
Fill with ice and set aside.
Add the remaining ingredients to a shaker and fill with ice.
Shake well and strain into the prepared glass.
Garnish with a jalapeño pepper.

drinkName.name: Mata Hari
drinkName.about: You’ll think completely differently about chai after tasting it in this cognac-based cocktail.

mix.how: Add all the ingredients to a mixing glass and fill with large, cold ice cubes.
Shakevigorously and strain into a chilled cocktail glass.
Garnish with three dried organic rosebuds.

drinkName.name: Bourbon Manhattan
drinkName.about: You don’t need to be in the five boroughs to enjoy this sophisticated tipple.

mix.how: Add all the ingredients into a mixing glass with ice and stir.
Strain into a chilled cocktail glass.
Garnish with a cherry.
(If you prefer a dry Manhattan, use dry vermouth instead of sweet and garnish with a lemon twist.).

drinkName.name: Lincoln Club Cooler
drinkName.about: After a few sips you’ll be begging to join.

mix.how: Add the rum and ginger ale to a highball glass filled with ice.

drinkName.name: Red Red “Vine”
drinkName.about: Neil Diamond would surely approve of this gin, grape and mint cocktail.

mix.how: In a shaker, muddle the grapes.
Add the remaining ingredients except the club soda and fill with ice.
Shake well and double strain into a highball glass filled with fresh ice.
Top with club soda and garnish with a mint leaf and a grape cluster.

drinkName.name: Manhattan
drinkName.about: Every home bartender should know how to make one of these.

mix.how: Add all the ingredients to a mixing glass with ice and stir until exceedingly well-chilled.
Strain into a chilled coupe glass.
Garnish with a lemon twist.

drinkName.name: Fat Like Buddha
drinkName.about: The perfect companion on the road to enlightenment.

ingredients.ingredient: Flor de Caña 7-Year-Old Grand Reserve Rum

mix.how: Add all the ingredients to a mixing glass and fill with ice.
Stir, and strain into a coupe or rocks glass.
Garnish with an orange twist.
